meanings.definition: The act of renouncing or rejecting something formally.
meanings.sent1: His abjuration of sweets was evident when he refused the birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The abjuration of his old habits marked a new beginning for him.
meanings.sent3: The abjuration of vegetables seemed like a strange choice for a health-conscious person.
meanings.sent4: Her abjuration of social media was like cutting ties with the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The abjuration of his past mistakes was a step towards self-improvement.

meanings.definition: A solemn oath or declaration renouncing something.
meanings.sent1: She took the abjuration to never reveal the secret to anyone.
meanings.sent2: The abjuration of loyalty to the old king was a bold move.
meanings.sent3: His abjuration of eating ice cream on weekdays was met with disbelief by his friends.
meanings.sent4: The abjuration of war was the first step towards peace in the region.
meanings.sent5: The abjuration of his allegiance to the rival team surprised everyone.
